citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
On records inspection of 3/5/2024, it was found that Tobey, ID B11025, a female Greater rhea (hatched on 08/25/2011),
was weighed on 8/19/2021 at 23.3 kg. This was an 18% decrease from the last recorded weigh-in of 5/28/2018 at 28.3 kg.
The attending veterinarian was not informed of this significant decrease, (5 kg or 11 lbs.), in Tobey’s body weight.
Two years later, a keeper noted that Tobey looked visually lean on 8/25/2022. Once again, this information was not
conveyed to the attending veterinarian.
Finally, on 10/15/2023 Tobey’s weigh-in was recorded as 9.7 kg. This was a 58% decrease from the last recorded weigh-
in of 23.3 kg. The attending veterinarian was informed of the rhea's condition and veterinary care was started on
10/15/2023 but Tobey died 3 days later on 10/18/2023.
These consecutive instances of inadequate direct and frequent communication with the attending veterinarian and
inadequate daily observations led to the lack of timely veterinary care being provided for Tobey and ultimately resulted in
the rhea’s death on 10/18/2023. The necropsy report gross exam findings included a “…thin/ sharp keel, generalized
muscle atrophy and emaciated pectoralis musculature...” The histopathology report concluded the cause of death was
from “inanition and chronic inflammation of the biliary tree. The inflammation is likely ascending from the gastrointestinal
tract, which could be consistent with the clinical history of a foreign body.”
Each dealer or exhibitor shall establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that include daily observation
of all animals to assess their health and well-being; provided, however, that daily observation of animals may be
accomplished by someone other than the attending veterinarian; and provided further, that a mechanism of direct and
frequent communication is required so that timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior, and
well-being is conveyed to the attending veterinarian.
Corrected on 2/9/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
